laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal coronary arteries with a slow flow of contrast medium in the coronary bed and an aneurysm of the RCA.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: In May 2004, repeat coronary angiogram showed no coronary stenosis, flow in the coronary bed remained slow, but the right CAA significantly enlarged.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Complete disappearance of the aneurysm, with the sinus node artery left in situ and a patent anastomosis of the RITA to the distal RCA, slow flow of contrast in the coronary bed.
